column2: CL2010, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started to take Ortho Cyclen when my acne started to act up. I was on Ortho Cyclen for about 1.5 years, then noticed no vaginal discharge or lubrication. My OBGYN decided to put my on Ortho Tri Cylcen, I was on this for 6 months. Both helped with the acne, but I still had vaginal discomfort. I wouldn't suggest this pill to anyone. It took a toll on my three year relationship, and threatened my new one. I have been off birth control for about 2 weeks, and already have see a huge difference. My discharge is starting to come back and so is my desire for sex.

column2: timeforachange, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I'd like to start by saying I'm a non-smoker who eats healthy and exercises regularly.  This is the only prescription med I'm on.  I have been on Ortho Cyclen for just over a decade.  I just turned 30 this year, and I've started to put two and two together, in terms of realizing that something was not quite right.  In terms of effectiveness as birth control, I've never had a problem; in terms of effects on other elements of my life, I'm starting to see evidence of problems.  Maybe it's in part due to my own changing chemistry as I age, or the length of time I've been on this med, but I'm finding myself to be moodier, having trouble sleeping through the night (it's not unusual to wake up around 2am...3am...4am...sometimes, with whacked out, vivid, frightening dreams...then I'm exhausted when my alarm actually goes off, of course...mind you, I was the college kid who used to sleep to 2pm on a weekend without issue), and showing signs of depression (which was never a problem for me).  I can't point to a problem in my life looming big enough to make me so quick to cry and so depressed, so that has me worried.  On top of that, I'm a competitive athlete, and my season is in the summer--guess what that means?  My skin gets a lovely mottled effect when I tan (especially on my thighs).  I used to consistently turn a nice, golden brown on account of my Mediterranean heritage.  Now I'm pretty sure I could match a leopard for camouflage.  In short, I think it's time for me and Ortho Cyclen to part ways.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I had absolutely no problems with Yaz/Beyaz/Gianvi and would recommend those if you don't mind paying $30/month. column2: Amy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was originally on this pill 15 years ago- I was switched for insurance reasons to OrthoTriCyclen and then OrthoTriCyclen-Lo.  I just got back on the OrthoCyclen because I loved the way my body felt while I was on it at age 25. The first 2 days I had mild stomach upset, nothing major, and a mild funny headache.  Those symptoms are gone and I have noticed a huge improvement in my very acne-prone skin:  no breakouts at all and my scarring has lightened!  Also it is difficult for me to maintain a healthy weight; I have been underweight with lack of energy on my previous pills but now my appetite has increased and I have gained about 3 lbs in the past week.  Most women would consider this a bad side effect but I am very pleased- also my breasts feel and look fuller but not tender. Every woman's chemistry is different, but for me this pill is fantastic!

The overall experience has been better than with Ortho TRI cyclen and Sronyx. If it wasn't for these horrid rashes I would stay on it.

column2: NicoleY, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have suffered from PMDD for as long as I can remember as many other women in my family also have.  I took Yaz for many years and while it helped, it really only took the edge off, I still suffered from being tired, irritable, swings in my appetite, etc.  I was advised to discontinue Yaz by my OB and so I opted to try a few different anit-depressants, those were a huge mistake. I've tried herbal supplements, change in diet etc, nothing worked. Then I read an article about how estrogen begins to decline in your 30's.  Since progesterone is what makes PMDD bad I realized I needed more estrogen.  I paid a visit to my OB/Gyn who put me on Ortho-Cyclen.  It has the highest level of estrogen you can get along with the lowest level of progestin, exactly what I needed.  I'm into my second month and my PMDD has been better than I can ever remember it.  My skin is adjusting, my boobs have grown 2 cups sizes, since my appetite is more consistent I've put on 8 pounds but the hubby likes it so that's not all bad.  I went through IVF with one of my kids so I know what higher levels of hormones can do and that it will take some time to adjust.  My cervix was definitely sensitive the first month; any time we had sex and he would bump into it I'd have a good bit of spotting.  That has stopped though.  This med is absolutely not right for everyone, given the high level of estrogen and really low level of progestin I imagine that most would have issues with it.  For me its great and although I hate taking a pill everyday it is 100% worth not having to deal with moderate PMDD symptoms.  I think if you suffer from estrogen deficiency or PMDD Ortho-Cyclen would be something to consider.

column2: JC, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

Yeah, I should of know that but I', learning. lol Plus I played around with it and it stretch my cyclen out to about 2 weeks. Yeah, I wasn't a happy camper but I got back on my schedule until last month. The side affect I had was mood swings and craving. That's why I change it from the morning to the evening. Other then that this birth control was pretty good to me. It also help me with my cramps so that was a great bonus! Since I now have Insurance, I had to leave the clinic and find a OB/GYN. I found one and she suggested  Sprintec 28 since it's a cheaper brand with the same ingrendants.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been a regular user of Ortho Tri-Cyclen for over 15 years.  I never had any major problems, however, when I tried to take the pills continuously (w/out taking the placebo pill) to stop my periods, I was having continuous spotting.  My doctor recommended that I try Ortho Cyclen to see if my spotting would stop.  Well, the spotting has gotten worse -- I have even seen blood clots.  In addition, I developed a yeast infection which I haven't had in years.  The yeast infection was treated but I still have soreness and mild itching.  My breast size increased and is very sore and tender.  I have also experienced bloating --I thought that it would go away but it hasn't. Plus acne on my forehead,which I never get.  Finally, and this is probably the worse side effect that I have experienced, are major mood swings.  For the past few days I have felt on the verge of tears and I have flown off the handle at the smallest things.  My boyfriend has noticed a change in my behavior as well.  Based on my experience with this pill, I am definitely going to go back to my old pill.  I was hoping that I could minimize the amount of periods I have, but I would rather deal with a few days of seeing my period than to deal with these side effects again.

Will be checking in if I decide to go for it. I do highly recommend Lo-Ogesterol. Up until now I've been great with it. Oh the darn aging!!!

column2: Dawn H., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was on Ortho Cyclen for 17 years, and was very satisfied.  I never became pregnant, and I liked the regularity of my cycle.  My skin improved and it was easy to use.  HOWEVER, now that I am in my mid 30's, a serious health condition appeared.  I have developed over 10 blood clots in my abdominal region which was almost fatal.  I spent time in the hospital, and am now on blood thinners for the next 6 months.  Please take the blood clot warning seriously!!!  I can never take a hormone again for the rest of my life.  Blood tests proved that the clots were not hereditary or genetic, but simply a side effect of the birth control.  During my annual exams, I always asked if I should stop and was encouraged to stay on the pill.  I wish I would have stopped much sooner, and avoided this potentially life threatening condition.  Since this happened to me, many women have told me about clots in their legs and lungs as a result of being on the pill.  I just want the public to be aware of the risk.  I have no complaint against Ortho-Cyclen, this is simply my experience.  Thank you.

column2: Veronica, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking Cyclen in July 2009. I have acne - not mild not severe. I took this pill to kill 2 birds with 1 stone. - PREGNANCY: It worked to prevent pregnancy.  -ACNE: my acne worstened. I stayed on it for 3 months thinking that it would eventually get better. But no luck. I'm off of it and i am currently trying tri-cyclen lo.- SIDE EFFECTS: close to the end of the 1st month going into the 2nd month of using this I couldnt stand up in one spot for too long, i was starting to get headaches more frequently, and i was tired quite often. I became very depressed, I was very dramatic- crying all the time for no reason. My sex drive wasnt gone, but it did slightly decrease.CONCLUSION: My friend is using this BC and it works great for her, her boobs got bigger her skin is great. On the other hand this pill was a nightmare! I did a detox right after to cleanse my body of it. Everybody is different what works for one individual may not work for another. And what stinks about BC is that you wont actually know until you try it and see how your body reacts! Good luck!

column2: Megand2303, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for contriceptive reasons but have experienced nausea and headaches and continual hair loss the side effects are not worth the use of this drug.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Ortho Cyclen for almost 8 years and it has served me very well. No major side effects, I have only spotted in between periods two times. I would highly recommend this pill!

column2: pillhater, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for over a month, and started my period early. I've been bleeding for over 10 days now and it won't stop! Can someone tell me if they had similar issue, and if they did anything to stop the bleeding? Any info would be greatly appreciated! jbpi777@yahoo.com

column2: something_new, 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I'm trying not to get pregnant for a very long time. I've just started the pill & sleep has been an issue so far.I can almost go a whole day without sleep. My biggest complaint is the severe mood swings that I've been experiencing. One minute I'm on cloud nine the next I can't stand the sight of anyone. In one day I can go through a series of moods,...irritated, loving, happy, sad, lonely & extremely mad. I'm hoping this is a side affect that will end shortly.

column2: hateortho25, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this pill for 3 months now and hate it... it was supposed to help my PCOS but instead gave me spotting every month on day 1-3 of week 3, terrible, horrible, aweful cramps and heavy heavy bleeding for periods, and emotional chaos, not to mention terrible mood swings. I was on lo-ovral before and am going to be switching back! don't take this!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Works great I used to have the worse cramps and bleeding and the pain was so bad I couldn't even go to school sometimes. Since been on this pill no cramps at all sometimes just a little discomfort like 5 minutes before it comes so now its very pradictable same time same day every month...And I never take it at the exact time everyday just sometime at night. And Very effective contraceptive. only real side effects I would say sometimes cramping in my legs but not as bad as the back and abdomen pains before using!

column2: Twig51, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was switched to Ortho-Cyclen when I began spotting on my old pill. I've been on it for about 2 months now and wouldn't recommend it, but every person reacts differently. I had numerous side effects: Acne worsened, increased insomnia, increased headaches, nausea, vaginal dryness and therefore painful intercourse, long period (lasted 9 days instead of the 7 you would think from the "off" week) and loss of mental clarity. This is the first non-low dose BC pill I've taken. I'm not sure if it was just too much for me or if the drug itself just was not a good fit for me. The generic Sprintec is nicely priced, though, compared to Loestrin 24, which I used to take and has no generics yet. I'm hoping to switch back to my old pill - loved it!

column2: Rubywrist, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Ortho-Cyclen for almost 10 years now. I initially started taking it because my periods would come very irregularly, and I had pretty bad cramping. Once on this pill, my periods have become very regular and I rarely get cramps. Having to take it at the same time every day can be a pain, but I picked a time when I knew I would be up, and set a daily reminder on my cell phone. In general, I'm very happy with this pill!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: This is the first time for me on birth control. I've only been on this pill for a little over a month and so far have had No serious side effects. The only side effect has been that at the beginning of the first and now the second pack, I've felt my breasts a little swollen. And I think they're slightly bigger... but thats fine with me :) I guess side effects will vary from person to person.

column2: sickofbeingsick, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: please ignore that previous review about always having nausea...I'm pregnant. Guess it was not very effective for me.

column2: sickofbeingsick, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used Ortho Cyclen for a little over a month and never recevied a period. Although I had cramps and the normal feeling of having a period. Around week 5 I started havine severe nausea everyday and always felt sick. Would not recommend.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had my period for 2 weeks, and it will not go away.  I take my medicine at the same time everyday.  I have also had weight gain, acne, and my mood has been a little unstable (crying, sadness, anxiousness).

column2: Housewife01, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had hormonal issues since I was 13 and my ob/gyn has changed my pills quite a few times already due to them not being a high enough dosage. I have only been taking Ortho-cyclen for about a month or so. I have noticed that my migraines have worsened a bit, I have experienced horrible cramping all month long even when not on my period, I have gained a few pounds or at least I feel really bloated,I have noticed a significant increase in vaginal fluids, increased breast sensitivity (which I enjoy most of the time and my husband does as well ;) ), swelling in my breasts (which once again my husband does not mind ;) )but the most annoying side effect of all is the fact that I start to bleed heavily while having sex with my husband. We have began using lubricant to ease the friction and ease the bleeding, but it doesn't always work. I am planning on sticking it out for another month or so and seeing if things improve, since I know if I go to my ob/gyn she will tell me the same thing.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I recently switched off of this birth control because I was getting my period twice a month for 6 straight months. I've always had very regular periods, so this was pretty unusual for me. I've recently started taking a new birth control and my period is back to normal

column2: blue*eyes, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is a good birth control option. No bad side effects for me. It has also cleared my skin up and caused my periods to be much less painful. I just wish you didn't have to take it at the same time every day.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
almita, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Please stay away from this pill, this pill caused me Pulmonary Embolism (blood clots in my lungs) thank god I was diagnosed on time, if not I could have died. And my doctor's told me this was caused by this birth control pill. Please don't use it.

column2: 1976dodge, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: Started taking when I was15 for cramps &acne worked amazing! Started taking after my daughter was born &haven't been as satisfied. I have acne again, and had break through bleeding the first few months.

column2: DearPrudence, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Absolutely no side effects (besides the perks of lighter periods and clearer skin).I switched to this pill after a couple of years on the birth control patch and I'm really glad I did.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ortho cyclen keeps me up at night, my apetite decreased, and it was difficult to wear my contacts.  Ortho tri-cyclen works better for me!!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Ortho-Cyclen for 2 1/2 years after switching off of Yasmine (which I hated) Its been a very effective pill, but this month I started spotting and it seems that it happens sometimes after taking this pill for a few years.

column2: hadtoquit, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: To tell the truth this has been hell on me. I can't stop vomiting, I have constant headaches and depression. I can't eat (and keep it down), I can't sleep, my heart won't stop racing. Frankly for me this has been pure evil in pill form. I'm glad to see this isn't true for some people, but almost every other site I have been to there are tons of women who are reporting the same symptoms. I would suggest having a long talk with your doctor if they prescribed it to you and I am reviewing this to warn others to be careful about this stuff.

column2: beautifuldisaster, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am generally happy with this BCP. I started taking this when I was 16 to help with my acne, and although it has helped, I still have to be religious with my skin care routine. I have noticed that over the years I have started to get migranes the first day of my period. I have not experienced any weight gain on this pill. I have started spotting mid month for a few days in about the past 6 months or so, some months are worse than others. I did get EXTREMELY moody when i first started it, and I am still pretty bitchy before my period. I had zero cramps when I started this pill, but have since started getting mild to moderate cramps every month. I would definitely recommend this pill, although I am starting to question it's ability to be a long term pill choice.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i get sick every morning just as i did when i was pregnant 3 years ago.  it started about 4 weeks after i started taking the pill and  that was 6 weeks after i had my son.  at first i was freaking out and thought i was already pregnant again but thats not it i have puked every morning for the past 2 and a half years so its pretty obvious im not pregant i just want to know what i do to not get sick like that every morning

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took this to have fewer and less painful cramps, I've been taking it for almost a year now and whenever I have my period I still have to take my 3 advil, 3 times a day, the week before, during, and after my period. I've also gained a lot of weight and have an extremely difficult time losing it when it was something I didn't even have to think about when I wasn't on it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: YIKES!!! Severe, I mean SEVERE emotional problems after 3 months of use. Cycle became longer and heavier and "clottier" [disgusting] each time as well. Atleast I did not end up with any unwanted zygotes!!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a great form of birth control to use. I haven't relly experienced any side effects, and any I have weren't bad and never lasted long. My periods are also very light, short and involve less severe cramping. I love it. :-)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Great birth control pill to take. Slight side effects only lasted a few days. I totally recommend this.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for about six months now and have really liked it.  The side effects are minimal, just some light spotting in the first few months, and headaches every once in awhile.  It has reduced my period from 5 days to 3 days, and it has also cleared up my acne.
